title: Unique Wines Tasting At Barossa And McLaren Vale (lastminute daytour)
text: By lastminute daytour Sep 26, 2015 Mc Laren is a place where wine meets the sea. The gorgeous south Australian district will offer you amazing wine and mouth watering food. You will experience love and feel of a country town. This place is just about 40 minutes from south Adelaide. It is known as one of the best wine region in the whole world. It is a perfect getaway for those who want to spend some quality time with their friends and family. Wine tours of McLaren vale is a perfect spot to rejuvenate yourself by leaving behind all your hassle and hectic life. The people of Mc Laren are totally dedicated in producing good quality of wine and food. The area is surrounded by lush green trees with some high end mountains touching the blue endless sky. Shiraz is one of the most vital productions in McLaren. Choosing the best Australian Shiraz bottle is bit of a challenge for everyone for those who love wine. McLaren Valley is one of the most beautiful wineries of Adelaide. McLaren Vale winery offers you exclusive wines such as Fox Creek, Hugh Hamilton, Graham Stevens, and Cariole etc. They also arrange activities like wine tasting, walk in the winery and lunch in the afternoon.Barossa is a perfect spot to enjoy your day with best exclusive wines and scenic natural beauty of landscapes. These Barossa wineries will give you a chance to make your day memorable and to have a marvelous experience. They take all the visitors around some finest vineyards in the region. You can also enjoy the forest trails, cottages, small valley during the journey. Drive tours to Barossa Valley is very famous and enjoyed by both youngsters and oldies.Don't wait for some special occasion. Plan some astonishing day tours or weekend getaways to Barossa Valley. You can plan a day trip from Adelaide to Barossa Valley to enjoy your day with some unforgettable memories. If you consider yourself a wine expert, than you must experience this magnificent wine tours at Barossa Valley.
